front.title: A Secure Call-ID for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: Many SIP devices generate Call-ID values which contain their system IP Address, due to examples and normative text in RFC 3261. This Kaplan Expires September 1, 2009 [page 1] SIP Secure Call-ID March 2009 has led to some middleboxes, such as SBC's, to change the Call-ID for security reasons. This draft updates RFC 3261 to require SIP User Agents to generate benign Call-IDs, in such a manner that they can be detected as secure and not need to be changed.
